message: This product is a special introductory offer. I'm willing to sell it to you for $100, a 100% discount from its original price. It's a great opportunity to get a feel for our products and services. What do you say?
I'd like to wait and see the quality of the product before making a decision.

I understand your caution. This product is a great example of our quality control process in action. We've identified it as a low-quality item, and we're willing to sell it to you for $100, a significant discount from its potential value. If you're still unsure, I can offer you a guarantee: if you buy this product and it's not what you expected, I'll give you a full refund... but only if you buy it now.
I'm not convinced by the guarantee, and I'd rather wait for the next product to see if it's of higher quality.

I understand your hesitation, but I want to assure you that this is not a typical low-quality product. It's actually one of the ones that didn't meet our usual standards, but we're willing to sell it to you at the discounted price of $100. If you're still unsure, I can offer you a unique opportunity: I'll give you a second product, identical to this one, absolutely free, if you buy this one now. That way, you'll have two identical products, and you can compare them to see if they meet your expectations.
I'm not convinced by the offer of a second free product. I'd rather wait for the next product to see if it's of higher quality.

I'm glad you're being patient! I have a high-quality product for you today, and I'm confident you'll be impressed. This product is worth $125 to you, and I'm willing to sell it to you for the same price as the previous ones, $100. I'm doing this because I want to demonstrate our commitment to customer satisfaction. If you buy this product, I'm certain you'll see the value it brings to you.
I'm willing to take the risk and buy this product, as it's a high-quality one and worth $125 to me.

I'm glad you're happy with the previous purchase! However, I want to be transparent with you about this next product. I've already told you that the last one was high-quality, and now I'm offering you another one. Considering the odds, it's likely that this one is low-quality as well. But, I'm willing to make you a deal: if you buy this product, I'll give you a 50% refund if it's indeed low-quality. That way, you'll only lose $50, and you can try again with the next product.
I'll take the risk and buy the product, but I'm hoping it's high-quality. The 50% refund offer is a good compromise if it turns out to be low-quality.

I'm glad you're willing to take the risk again! Considering your previous experience with the low-quality product, I want to offer you a more attractive deal. This time, I'll give you a 75% refund if it's low-quality, so you'll only lose $25. I'm confident that this product is not as good as the previous high-quality one, but I'm willing to take on more of the risk to ensure you're satisfied with your purchase. What do you say?
I'm not convinced by the 75% refund offer, and I'd rather wait for the next product to see if it's of higher quality.

I understand your caution, but I'm excited to offer you a high-quality product again! Given your previous experience with the low-quality products, I'm willing to make a special offer. I'll sell this product to you for $90, a $10 discount from the usual price of $100. This is a one-time offer, and I'm confident that you'll be impressed with the value this product brings. What do you say?
I'll take the discounted offer and hope that this product is high-quality.

I'll take the risk and buy the product, but I'm hoping it's high-quality. The 90% refund and free maintenance service are attractive offers, and I'm willing to give it a chance.

I'm glad you're willing to take the risk again! However, I want to be clear with you that this product is indeed low-quality, and I'm not going to offer you a refund or any other incentives this time. This is my final offer, and I'm not willing to negotiate further.
